symptoms.name: Redness
symptoms.pattern: Bilateral and symmetrical, but can be unilateral

symptoms.name: Erosion
symptoms.pattern: At the corners of the mouth

symptoms.name: Crusting
symptoms.pattern: At the corners of the mouth

symptoms.name: Oozing
symptoms.pattern: At the corners of the mouth

symptoms.name: Maceration
symptoms.pattern: Greyish appearance at the corners of the mouth

physical_findings: Inflammation at the corners of the mouth (oral commissures)
Redness and/or erosion of the lateral oral skin folds
Crusting and oozing at the angles of the mouth
Greyish maceration at the angles of the mouth (in some cases)
Possible pale areas surrounded by a darkened rim in dark skin
risk_factors: Prolonged exposure of the corners of the mouth to saliva and its digestive enzymes

required: Clinical presentation consistent with candidal cheilitis (redness, erosion, crusting, oozing at the corners of the mouth)

differential_diagnoses: Other forms of cheilitis (e.g., angular cheilitis due to other causes)
